com.inqwell.any

Interface ResourceAllocator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Any, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractResourceAllocator, ConnectManager, InqIoManager, ServerConnectionManager, SqlManager

    public interface ResourceAllocator
extends Any

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Any acquire(Any specification)
      Acquire, or wait indefinitely until available for, the resource identified by the given identifier.
      Any acquire(Any id, long timeout)
      Acquire for the current process, waiting at most the specified time for, the resource identified by the given identifier.
      Any acquire(Any id, Process acquirer, long timeout)
      Acquire, for the specified Process, waiting at most the specified time for, the resource identified by the given identifier.
      int getResourcesMade(Any spec)
      Returns the number of resources currently available for allocation, whether or not they are currently allocated to a user.
      Any getSpec(Any id)
      Fetch the configuration information for this resource id.
      void release(Any id, Any resource, Any arg, ExceptionContainer e)
      Release the given resource.
      void release(Any id, Process releaser, Any resource, Any arg, ExceptionContainer e)
      Release the given resource.

    • Method Detail

      • acquire

        Any acquire(Any specification)
     throws AnyException
        Acquire, or wait indefinitely until available for, the resource identified by the given identifier.
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of the resource being acquired
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • acquire

        Any acquire(Any id,
            long timeout)
     throws AnyException
        Acquire for the current process, waiting at most the specified time for, the resource identified by the given identifier.
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of the resource being acquired
        timeout - the amount of time, in ms, to wait for the resource to become available. -1 is an indefinite wait.
        Returns:
        the acquired resource
        Throws:
        AnyException - if no resource became available in the finite wait time or none could be made.

      • acquire

        Any acquire(Any id,
            Process acquirer,
            long timeout)
     throws AnyException
        Acquire, for the specified Process, waiting at most the specified time for, the resource identified by the given identifier.
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of the resource being acquired
        acquirer - the Process acquiring the resource
        timeout - the amount of time, in ms, to wait for the resource to become available. -1 is an indefinite wait.
        Returns:
        the acquired resource
        Throws:
        AnyException - if no resource became available in the finite wait time or none could be made.

      • release

        void release(Any id,
             Any resource,
             Any arg,
             ExceptionContainer e)
      throws AnyException
        Release the given resource. It is undefined what happens if the id is not the same as the one used to acquire the resource. The current process is assumed to be the present owner of the resource.
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • release

        void release(Any id,
             Process releaser,
             Any resource,
             Any arg,
             ExceptionContainer e)
      throws AnyException
        Release the given resource. It is undefined what happens if the id is not the same as the one used to acquire the resource.

        Releasing a resource may involve exception-prone operations, for example an SQL connection committing a transaction. Implementations may choose to throw or return any such exception via the ExceptionContainer argument.

        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of the resource being released
        releaser - current owner of the resource.
        arg - an additional argument that can be used by implementations as required
        e - an ExceptionContainer through which an exception occurring during release may be returned.
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • getResourcesMade

        int getResourcesMade(Any spec)
        Returns the number of resources currently available for allocation, whether or not they are currently allocated to a user.
        Returns:
        the number of resources available, or zero if none have been created or the specification is unknown.

      • getSpec

        Any getSpec(Any id)
        Fetch the configuration information for this resource id. The information returned depends on the implementation. For a pool of SQL connections there may be login details together with any aspects of how the JDBC driver behaves.
        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:
        The configuration information, typically a Map
